ygData.subject: RE: Digest Number 81
ygData.msgSnippet: ... YEP, I had an identical experiance.  I play a dark elf, so lucky for me I had the firepower of my race and its diversity of classes to aid me in my
ygData.messageBody:
>
>1) I have played him for 16 days and only 16th level. You might ask what
>the problem is. I started a Shaman out 5 playing days ago and he is now
>16th level.

YEP, I had an identical experiance. I play a dark elf, so lucky for me I
had the firepower of my race and its diversity of classes to aid me in my
adventures. SKs level SLOW, you've seen that. A big part of playing a
character, any character, is mindset. With your success at developing the
shaman, I would say you have a spell caster mindset and work best in that
environment. A tank rarely has the benefit to step back and survey the
battle field like a caster does, we have to work through the chaos of being
IN the spellfire and meele and find the best target to taunt and or fight.
That is very hard to do, I cannot teach it. It's something you will develop
yourself while playing a tank or realise as your Shaman ages and you watch
senior tanks at work.


Last night I had 2 guild invites and my SK never had one (until
>I asked a guild, get into that in a moment). The only reason I started a
>Shaman because I heard they were wanted in groups, and I always had a rough
>time finding anyone who wanted to group with me.

Bad taste abounds. You cannot fault someone for not wanting to risk their
XP to a tank they have likely never run with.

Understand this though, tanks rule the game as the players all age. A party
with no combat class or inadequate combatants will die and die often. If
you don't believe me, do Cazic Thule or Guk with a bad tank:caster ratio and
see how many time you dash for the zone.

Contrary to popular belief, clerics and shaman are NOT tanks. Warriors
CANNOT stop a fleeing mob. Root is NOT a reliable means of ensuring the mob
does not flee(very valuable in dungeons), and when rooted the creature turns
and keeps fighting. So, what does that leave you with? A Ranger or an Sk.
Ok the Ranger is a great class, no doubt about it. Snare kicks butt and
they have that nifty dual attack and wield which makes mobs insane with
aggro. We (Sks) have the darkness series up to Dooming Darkness. It can be
cast during the battle to soften the mob, during the escape to slow it (and
it doesn't turn to hit anyone), AND it does damage the whole while.
Combined with fear you have a slow moving beast that is doomed to die. Dump
enough damage into it and it will be in flee mode when the fear wares off,
if not then just repeat.

Fear+darkness works great on large outdoor lethal mobs that the party may
not be high enough to handle but wants to engage: Kodiaks, Griffawns, Giant
Skells, Treants.
Couple that with the LOW aggro caused by your slow yet heavy hitting weapon
and you have a high probability that the creature will turn to the taunt of
a PET over you or a caster if done right! Group still doesn't want you?
Then they're dumb because the true talent of the Sk is mob CONTROLL and we
just get better at it as we age.

ARG, I remember being told there was no room for me in a group as an SK. It
sucked! I simply chose to fight beside them and when they saw that I was
killing stuff they had to tag team (via above method) I was quickly invited,
but enough about my history.

>2) Armor. In east commons and "/auction WTB banded armor" and have never
>gotten a response. So I still am running around in leather, with a SBH
>that I bought from someone for 100 plat.

Ok, you're lvl 16? Go hunt in High Pass Hold. Orc side drops consist of
your SBH and ringmail that fits a human or smaller and Gnoll side drops the
PGT and ringmail that fits a size large. You can also hunt Runny Eye for
Blackened Platemail at your level. As far as the SBH goes, i used one until
i was lvl 23...yep 23. At that point I was able to convince some guildmates
to help me get a BBC and through dumb luck not soon after I killed the
Reckless Efreet in Solusek's Eye for the Obsidian Flamberge. Now I have the
Dark Reaver. Look, the weapons will come. You definitely are lacking in
the armor area. I recommend forgetting about this phantom guild guy with
the banded. Go to High Pass, kill Orcs or Gnolls and get yourself some
ringmail. If you are on a carebear server bring cash to buy pieces off of
players that got the loot you needed. It can be done.


>I normally don't get upset at things, but this I feel is just insane. I
>was
>reading on another list that Brian/Veriant thinks SK Troll/Orge is fine but
>the DE/Human is just screwed but any type of modification other than
>equipment would make the entire class unbalanced. He/They (whomever) found
>that the Mage Tank (anti-paladin) was unacceptable, and was a scary thing
>to
>see.... hmm... aren't we suppose to be?

Power gamers are always comparing stats vs this and race vs that...hogwash.
Play the race/class you can relate to and enjoy. I will not tell you that I
do not envy the Troll's regen or the Ogre's raw power or the human's ability
to travel. I can tell you that I can cast spells all day and my agility
keeps me nice and cozy(and my clerics happy)as I am not hit as often as my
larger counterparts. I can also tell you that, in my opinion, the Dark
Elves have the best fire support when grouped due to the diversity in their
race. I could ramble 4 ever on why I feel this is true but I will just say
experience it for yourself. (although I suppose on non-PvP servers you get
a homogeneous mixture of races and classes in a group, oh well)

Personally I would think that if
>you have a higher experience penalty you should be stronger than the other
>classes that don't have the penalty.

We are very very powerful, I don't flaunt it because I don%27t want a
hunderd DE Sks running around Nectulos trying to see for themselves. I want
to remain special, unique, and a mystery. My ravings here are for those
poor souls who have already committed to the Path of Innoruuk and the often
painful life of the dreaded Shadowknight. Stick with it, stay in touch, and
you will reap rewards.

BTW, the single most devastating PvP player on Rallos Zek, bar none, is a
human Shadowknight of lvl 43 when I met him last. He has wasted more people
than anyone I know, he is not in a guild and he kills his enemies ALONE. As
I advance and occasionally skirmish with PKs I am beginning to see why, I
haven't been killed by another player since I was lvl 13 (remember mob
control?). He makes the same claim. Coincidence? No.

Good luck David I hope I helped.

Xillith, devoted Knight and daughter of our Lord in Hatred
Blood Coven
Rallos Zek
